DOCNAME: YILMAZ v. CYPRUS AND OTHER APPLICATIONS
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . A list of the applicants is set out in the appendix .
The applicants are either owners , or the heirs of owners , of property which is governed by the custodianship regime under LAW .

None of the applicants have taken proceedings in the domestic courts or brought such proceedings to a conclusion . The third applicant in no . CARDINAL claims to have proceedings pending but no documents or details have been provided .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant is the heir of his grandfather who owned properties in GPE . He stated that he was unable to access or enjoy these properties .
He complains under LAW No . CARDINAL and LAW .

CARDINAL . The applicant who lived with his family near GPE in the south of GPE prior to DATE owned a number of properties , as did his deceased wife and other members of his family , also now deceased . Following DATE , the applicant sought to take steps to recover possession of this property . He instructed a lawyer who however took no steps to take proceedings . On CARDINAL DATE , the applicant sent a letter to the Minister of the ORG , listing the properties and requesting their return and compensation ; he sent a follow - up letter in DATE . He has received no substantive response .

CARDINAL . The applicant invokes LAW No . CARDINAL and LAW as regards the properties , Articles DATE and CARDINAL alleging lack of access to court and lack of an effective remedy and LAW alleging discrimination against NORP .

CARDINAL . Various property including houses , fields and shops were transferred to the applicant by his father and mother DATE . This property was administered by LAW under Law CARDINAL/CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant wrote to ORG , requesting return of the properties and full compensation for loss of use since DATE . He has received no reply .

CARDINAL . The applicant invokes LAW No . CARDINAL and LAW as regards the properties , Articles DATE and CARDINAL alleging lack of access to court and lack of an effective remedy and LAW alleging discrimination against NORP .
CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP , bought land in DATE and rented it out . The tenant paid rent until DATE when the authorities took over the applicant ’s property .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant wrote to ORG , requesting return of the properties and full compensation for loss of use since DATE . She received a response in DATE that the application would be examined and she would be informed in due course . She has received no further reply .

CARDINAL . The applicant invokes LAW No . CARDINAL and LAW as regards the properties , Articles DATE and CARDINAL alleging lack of access to court and lack of an effective remedy and LAW alleging discrimination against NORP .
CARDINAL . The relevant case - law and laws are set out in GPE and Others v. GPE ( no . DATE et al , § § CARDINAL , decision of CARDINAL DATE ) .
